noun.description: Scottish Law. The disavowal or repudiation of a vassal's obligations to a superior; an instance of this. Now historical.
The action of disclaiming; renunciation, repudiation, denial; an instance of this.

origin: Mid 16th century. From post-classical Latin disclamation-, disclamatio disclaimer, renunciation from disclamat-, past participial stem of disclamare + classical Latin -iō.
